Bioinformatics cookbook from Trembling bugs Guo-Cheng Li Doctor student at Chen-Zhu Wang lab Institute of Zoology, The Chinese Academy of Sciences   moths.life   liguocheng@ioz.ac.cn Begin at 2021-12-23 and Update at 2021-12-23 Welcome 这本书主要用来记录我在博士学习过程中的所见。所闻，所学以及所感。 Contact me: GitHub Wechat Please enable JavaScript to view the comments powered by Disqus. 致谢 感谢所有帮助过我的人。 李国成 于中科院奥运村科技园动物所A座

作者简介 你好！我是颤抖吧小虫子，目前在中科院动物所攻读博士学位，专业是昆虫生理生化，主要从事昆虫基因组与昆虫化学感受相关的工作。 Institute of Zoology, The Chinese Academy of Sciences E-mail: liguocheng@ioz.ac.cn My Blog: https://www.liguocheng.top/ My WeChat: 颤抖吧小虫子 My GitHub: https://github.com/guo-cheng My ORCID：https://orcid.org/0000-0001-5956-3252 我的公众号： 颤抖吧小虫子

第 9 章 拼图神器: patchwork包 9.1 例子 9.2 基本使用

第 9 章 拼图神器: patchwork包 Website: https://patchwork.data-imaginist.com/index.html Patchwork is a package designed to make plot composition in R extremely simple and powerful. It is mainly intended for users of ggplot2 and goes to great lengths to make sure ggplots are properly aligned no matter the complexity of your composition. library(patchwork) 9.1 例子 library(ggplot2) p1 <- ggplot(mtcars) + geom_point(aes(mpg, disp)) + ggtitle('Plot 1') p2 <- ggplot(mtcars) + geom_boxplot(aes(gear, disp, group = gear)) + ggtitle('Plot 2') p3 <- ggplot(mtcars) + geom_point(aes(hp, wt, colour = mpg)) + ggtitle('Plot 3') p4 <- ggplot(mtcars) + geom_bar(aes(gear)) + facet_wrap(~cyl) + ggtitle('Plot 4') 9.2 基本使用
A Rmarkdown使用 A.1 代码块 A.2 表格 A.3 bookdown制作图书

A Rmarkdown使用 A.1 代码块 > sin(pi/2) [1] 1 > cos(pi/2) [1] 6.123234e-17 > plot(pressure) ## 图片 plot(1:10) 图 A.1: point plot picture A.2 表格 x y value 1 2 4 a b c x <- 1:10; y <- x^2; lmr <- lm(y ~ x) co <- summary(lmr)$coefficients print(co) ## Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) ## (Intercept) -22 5.5497748 -3.964125 4.152962e-03 ## x 11 0.8944272 12.298374 1.777539e-06 knitr::kable(co, digits = 2, caption = "Fitting linear model: y ~ x") 表 A.1: Fitting linear model: y ~ x Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) -22 5.55 -3.96 0 x 11 0.89 12.30 0 library(knitr) library(kableExtra) kable(head(iris)) %>% kable_styling(latex_options = "striped", bootstrap_options = "bordered", full_width = F, position = "left") Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.9 3.0 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.7 3.2 1.3 0.2 setosa 4.6 3.1 1.5 0.2 setosa 5.0 3.6 1.4 0.2 setosa 5.4 3.9 1.7 0.4 setosa x_html <- knitr:: kable(head(rock), "html") x_html <- kableExtra::kable_styling(x_html, bootstrap_options = "striped", full_width = T) kableExtra::column_spec(x_html,1:2, bold = T, color = "white", background = "#D7261E") area peri shape perm 4990 2791.90 0.0903296 6.3 7002 3892.60 0.1486220 6.3 7558 3930.66 0.1833120 6.3 7352 3869.32 0.1170630 6.3 7943 3948.54 0.1224170 17.1 7979 4010.15 0.1670450 17.1 kableExtra::row_spec(x_html,1:2, bold = T, color = "white", background = "#D7261E") area peri shape perm 4990 2791.90 0.0903296 6.3 7002 3892.60 0.1486220 6.3 7558 3930.66 0.1833120 6.3 7352 3869.32 0.1170630 6.3 7943 3948.54 0.1224170 17.1 7979 4010.15 0.1670450 17.1 A.3 bookdown制作图书 编译单章 #bookdown::preview_chapter("chap-name.Rmd", output_format="bookdown::gitbook", encoding="UTF-8")
